title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions until al dente. Reserve 1/2 cup of pasta water and drain the rest.
In a pan, cook the pancetta or bacon over medium heat until crispy. Add minced garlic and sauté for 1 minute. Remove from heat.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and grated Parmesan cheese.
Add the cooked spaghetti to the pan with pancetta and toss to combine.
Remove the pan from heat and quickly pour in the egg and cheese mixture, tossing rapidly to create a creamy sauce. If needed, add reserved pasta water a little at a time to reach desired consistency.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: In a bowl, combine yogurt, lemon juice, cumin, coriander, turmeric, garam masala, and chili powder. Add chicken pieces and marinate for at least 1 hour.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for another minute until fragrant.
Add marinated chicken to the pan and cook until no longer pink.
Pour in canned tomatoes and simmer for 15-20 minutes until the chicken is cooked through.
Stir in heavy cream and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Vegetable Stir-Fry
summary: A quick and healthy vegetable stir-fry with a savory sauce.
ingredients: 1 tsp cornstarch mixed with 2 tbsp water (optional for thickening)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add minced garlic and grated ginger, sauté for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add all the vegetables and stir-fry for 5-7 minutes until they are tender-crisp.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, and sesame oil. Pour the sauce over the vegetables and toss to coat.
If you prefer a thicker sauce, add the cornstarch mixture and cook for another minute until the sauce thickens.
Garnish with sesame seeds if desired and serve hot with rice or noodles.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
summary: Classic homemade chocolate chip cookies with a chewy center and crispy edges.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line baking sheets with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla extract.
In a separate bowl, combine the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt. Gradually blend this into the creamed mixture.
Fold in the chocolate chips.
Drop rounded spoonfuls of dough onto the prepared baking sheets.
Bake for 10-12 minutes or until edges are golden brown. Allow cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a few minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

title: Caesar Salad
summary: A fresh and crunchy Caesar salad with homemade dressing and croutons.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, minced garlic, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, Worcestershire sauce, and mayonnaise to make the dressing. Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
In a large salad bowl, combine chopped romaine lettuce, grated Parmesan cheese, and croutons.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat evenly.
Serve immediately as a side dish or add grilled chicken for a complete meal.

title: Pancakes
summary: Fluffy homemade pancakes perfect for a weekend breakfast.
instructions: In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, and melted butter; mix until smooth.
Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancakes and the edges are dry, then flip and cook until browned on the other side.
Serve hot with maple syrup, fresh fruit, or your favorite toppings.

title: Guacamole
summary: A creamy and flavorful avocado dip perfect for parties and snacks.
instructions: In a medium bowl, mash the avocados with a fork until smooth but still chunky.
Add lime juice and salt, mixing well to combine.
Stir in diced onion, tomatoes, cilantro, garlic, and jalapeño (if using).
Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or as a topping for tacos and other dishes.

title: Beef Tacos
summary: Delicious beef tacos with fresh toppings and a flavorful seasoning.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
Toppings: shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, sour cream, salsa
instructions: In a large skillet, cook the ground beef over medium heat until browned. Drain excess fat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic to the skillet and cook until softened.
Stir in chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, oregano, salt, and black pepper. Cook for another 2-3 minutes to let the flavors meld.
Warm the taco shells or tortillas according to package instructions.
Fill each taco shell with the seasoned beef mixture and top with your favorite toppings such as shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, grated cheese, sour cream, and salsa.
Serve immediately and enjoy!

title: Lemon Garlic Salmon
summary: A simple and flavorful lemon garlic salmon recipe perfect for a healthy dinner.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, minced garlic, lemon juice, and lemon zest.
Place salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet. Brush the lemon garlic mixture over the salmon.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily with a fork.
Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve with your favorite side dishes.

title: Caprese Salad
summary: A simple and elegant Italian salad made with fresh tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: On a large platter, alternate slices of tomato and mozzarella cheese.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices.
Drizzle extra virgin olive oil over the salad.
If desired, drizzle balsamic glaze for added flavor.
Season with salt and black pepper to taste.
Serve immediately as a refreshing appetizer or side dish.
